answers.answer: Twins runs on the womans side of the family. The woman is the one that makes the twins. Its a possibility in any pregnancy but would be more likely if twins ran on your mothers side.

so is my hcg levels suppose to jump like that or no? I have my first actual doctors appointment the 18th, it's hard to do all this cause I'm 3 hours away from home at school, and my mom wants me to come home to the doctors.

Not sure about the hcg level but I know they should at least double daily. Every day that it goes up is a good thing. Just relax and wait til you see the doc. If they suspect twins they will do an u/s. Good luck!!

Your HCG should be doubling every 48-72 hours.You should be eating a regular diet: whole grains, lean proteins, lots of fruits and vegetables, low-fat dairy. Get rid of pop, coffee, candy/junk. You should be eating your regular caloric intake (usually about 1200-1500 for women) with an added 500 calories per day. So an extra 500 calories might be a sandwich, for example. You don't have to count calories. I just want you to know you're not supposed to eat DOUBLE what you normally would eat.It helps to eat small, frequent meals as opposed to 3 solid meals. In early pregnancy you may begin to feel sick, so keeping something in your stomach throughout the day should help with that. Most women get really, really sick when they're hungry.Also, drink about 10 glasses of water a day.Gestational Diabetes is not caused by your eating habits. Some women are just pre-dispositioned to develop it. If others have had it in your family, it does not mean you will get it. But definitely watch what you eat anyway.
thank you so much, that helps me A LOT!

You're welcome! I was 19 when I got pregnant with my first and didn't know a thing. I didn't have Internet either, so I soaked up pregnancy books (library if you can't buy any) and subscribed to all the parenting magazines.I also ate way more than I should have and gained 50 lbs! I thought being pregnant meant I was literally eating for two and could eat whatever I wanted.Anyway, congrats!

lol, i bet that was rough. I'm in college right now, so I'm juggling this all at once; and I have back problems so it's already hard on me right now and it just started so I'm a bit worried, my mom wants me to come home next semester and I might just to be safe.

question: So I'm not even four weeks pregnant they have told me since I was in the hospital with pains(caused by ovarian cyst) my hcg level had jumped from 357 on early Sunday morning to 1135 Tuesday morning to 1634 the next day, could it be twins?  Twins run on my dads side of the family, it is every other generation usually, and I'm the next one to have them according to my mom. but I don't know much about this at all, so I'm worried. Also, what am I suppose to eat? I found out I'm slightly anemic and diabetes runs in my family when people get pregnant. Any information could help me at this time, please and thank you!
title: I'm only 19 and I have a lot of questions about pregnancy so please help
